dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S888 PCS: To provide end user exemptions from certain provisions of the Commodity Exchange Act and the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Johanns (for himself, Mr. Tester, Mr. Blunt, Mr. Crapo, Mr. Donnelly, Mrs. Hagan, Ms. Heitkamp, Ms. Klobuchar, Mr. Moran, Mr. Shelby, Mr. Toomey, Mr. Warner, and Mrs. Fischer) introduced the following bill; which was read the first time
Read the second time and placed on the calendar

form.official-title: To provide end user exemptions from certain provisions of the Commodity Exchange Act and the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.

paragraph.text: Section 4s(e) of the Commodity Exchange Act (7 U.S.C. 6s(e)), as added by section 731 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

The requirements of paragraphs (2)(A)(ii) and (2)(B)(ii) shall not apply to a swap in which a counterparty qualifies for an exception under section 2(h)(7)(A) or satisfies the criteria in section 2(h)(7)(D).

Section 15F(e) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78o–10(e)), as added by section 764(a) of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

The requirements of paragraphs (2)(A)(ii) and (2)(B)(ii) shall not apply to a security-based swap in which a counterparty qualifies for an exception under section 3C(g)(1) or satisfies the criteria in section 3C(g)(4).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section to the Commodity Exchange Act shall be implemented—

subparagraph.text: chapter 35 of title 44, United States Code; and

paragraph.text: through the promulgation of an interim final rule, pursuant to which public comment will be sought before a final rule is issued; and
such that paragraph (1) shall apply solely to changes to rules and regulations, or proposed rules and regulations, that are limited to and directly a consequence of such amendments.

endorsement.action-desc: Read the second time and placed on the calendar
